p:
We designed dsRNAs against Aedes aegypti RUVBL1 (AAEL004686), RUVBL2 (AAEL010341), and TIP60 (AAEL014072) orthologs. Prior to infection, Aag2 cells were treated with these dsRNAs or with dsRNAs against Bgal or the viral genome as negative and positive controls, respectively. Loss of RUVBL1, RUVBL2, or TIP60 mosquito orthologs did not affect cell number ( Figure S4B in Text S1 ) but led to a significant increase in WNV-KUN infection (p<0.05, Figure S4C in Text S1 and
Figure 4D ). Similarly, each of these genes had antiviral effects against VSV, as silencing resulted in increased infection (p<0.05, Figure S4D in Text S1 and
Figure 4E ). These data indicate that members of the Tip60 complex also have antiviral activity in cells from a mosquito vector.
